reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars a wonderful graphic novel
reviews.reviewText: Lady Camembert wants to live her life on her own terms. She doesn’t want to be forced to marry a man, especially since she isn’t attracted to them. After her father paces away, she journeys to the Kingdom of Fromage to start her life over as Count Camembert. While she is supposed to keep a low profile, she instead finds herself befriending Princess Brie and developing a crush on her as their friendship grows.This was an adorable graphic novel about finding yourself, true love, grilled cheese, friendship, and doing the right thing. Brie and Cam’s relationship was complicated because of the status difference, Cam’s hidden identity, and the pressures of parents. Their friendship was so beautiful and I loved seeing them crush on each other and struggle with the pressure and their different fears. The break up they faced just made their relationship so much stronger and I love how it pushed Brie to fight for changes in her kingdom. Just everything about Cam and Brie’s relationship was just so beautifully written and illustrated.Overall, this was a beautiful story and a beautifully illustrated graphic novel that does a great job at commenting on wealth, identity, power and privilege, especially on how it affects women differently. If you are looking for a YA queer graphic novel that has a lot of cheese references, definitely check this out.TW: death of a parent;

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Saw it on TikTok + Arrived a little earlier
reviews.reviewText: Contrasting other stuff I buy it arrived earlier, I was really surprised. It was nice.The book is like a comic book, the words in such a way you can’t help but read them with an accent.The illustrations are beautiful.If you want to read a love story but don’t wanna stare at a page full of words cuz you zoning out, this book would a nice break.If you’ve gotten used to digital reading and want to read a physical book this would help. The characters have already been so you can just enjoy the storyIf you struggle finding a voice for the characters try reading it out loud.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love this book even more than I love cheese
reviews.reviewText: I love this book. I want everyone in my life to read it. This graphic novel has shot up to being in my top 5 favorites, maybe my #1 favorite-- it joins the ranks of The Prince and the Dressmaker, Heartstopper, and Laura Dean Keeps Breaking Up with Me in writing level, emotional strength, and memorable-ness. It explores sexuality, romance, gender, expression, societal pressures in a way that is humorous and relieving in some ways, and heartbreaking in others. The characters are brilliantly, heartwarmingly, painfully realistic. I found myself cackling out loud and tearing up throughout the story. As soon as I finished reading it, I wanted to read it all over again. I will cherish this book, and terrorize all my friends and family into reading it. I wait in excitement for the next amazing story the author, Deya Muniz, writes next!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An absolute, utter delight of a story
reviews.reviewText: This book brought pure joy into my eyes. "Count Camembert" will be a favorite character for years to come, and my daughter and a good friend both promptly snagged the story and loved the heck out of it too. For kids who need to be seen, for people who love a classic farce tale and great storytelling, unique and beautiful illustrations, and memorable characters, this one's for you.The inheritance laws in England were ever ridiculous and misogynistic, and one father's creative way of getting around them leaves his grieving daughter with her home, fortune, and a loyal servant after his passing. Though staying under the radar is the best way to move forward, when the "count" crosses paths with the wonderful Princess Brie and finds a friendship and chemistry that defies conventions, all bets are off.I'll admit to not really getting the cheese theme, but I know there's meaning behind it, and the author went all out to embrace it and add layers of delight to the tale. And the ongoing impulse to eat grilled cheese sandwiches for lunch and dinner is an added bonus.HEA, secret identity, historical, FF romance. An utter delight of cheesy goodness. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My GF and I have wanted to read this book together for a while. As we expected, the art was great, but the story was very loose. So, to begin, the issue in the plot is that they live in an old fashion era that could repriment and ban their relationship BUT there are many not-funny moments when they are surrounded by modern things like switches and when they were wearing modern pajamas. I don't know. That was off putting. We also didn't find it funny. So...that was and odd desition. Besides that, there was a lot of girl boss exposition to believe that the protagonist really had an issue. Like, they did so many girl boss things that when they said 'ah yes but we wouldn't be able to be together' is like...that doesn't feel like the rules of this world. Besides that, something I didn't like as much was that the protagonist didn't work for their happy ending. It was rather their friends pushing them to be together. That made me feel disatisfied with the ending. I feel that it stole empowerment and ownership from the protagonists. Like, there is this boring guy thing that I guess was supposed to be the one to defeat and it didn't work because honestly he hasn't done anything bad but being boring. When he proposes it was kinda poorly constructed so when she humiliated him feels kinda bad. Like oh yes he deserves it because he is a man kinda thing (overdone in sapphic books). Plus, for a romantic book...they didn't even tell each other they liked each other first. That is like ... A big revelation in romance but...it wasn't them. It was Ricotta. So in those terms many plot desitions felt underwhelming... Even for a light romance that is supposed to be funny, these were key moments that felt poorly constructed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love grilled cheese sandwiches!!!
reviews.reviewText: This story was amazing!!! At first I was worried about the page count but I couldn't put this book down!!! The artwork was beautiful and the story was engaging!!!

This graphic novel got me back into reading after not doing it for sooooo long. I always loved to read but work keeps me demotivated to read for fun. It was a nice, short, and cozy read. Beautiful drawings. Very much recommend!
La novela grafica llego en buenas condiciones.El arte es muy bello y la historia es buena.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My eyes are filled with tears of happiness and I can't read it! I'm just so happyyyy, definitely would recommend! It's so good
Es una historia que no esperaba, el estilo de dibujo es increíble y no me ha podido gustar más

reviews.reviewTitle: Dieser Comic hat mich einfach nur glücklich gemacht!
reviews.reviewText: Eine sehr süße Sapphic Love Story, eingebettet in eine Welt zwischen altmodisch und modern. Zwei gut ausgearbeitete Hauptfiguren, liebeswerte Nebencharaktere. Einfach aufschlagen und in einem Zug durchlesen. Zeichnungen, Farben und Linienführung sind auf einem sehr hohem Niveau.
